result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher S. Hebert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample if not already done.
Complete AODA and assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Participate in counseling deemed necessary by agent.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S. Hebert

records.addlTxt: DNA Order & Acknowledgement and Proof of Submission

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:03 AM Room 301 Defendant Christopher S. Hebert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John Zich appeared by video for Christopher S. Hebert.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Def can hear all parties on zoom, and def consents to being present on zoom. Plea agreement. Def plea guilty on ct. 1 and ct. 2. On ct. 3 - dismiss but read in. On ct. 1 - impose and stayed 4 yrs prison, 2 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, consecutive any other sentence, costs, DNA sample unless already provided, $250 surcharge, AODA assessment, treatment as recommended, maintain absolute sobriety, maintain fulltime school/work, counseling deemed as necessary. On ct. 2 - withheld sentence, probation 3 yrs, concurrent to any other supervision, costs, DNA sample unless already provided, $250 surcharge, comply with conditions of ct. 1. Court reviews plea questionnaire. Def pleads no contest to Cts. 1 and 2. Court grants to dismiss but read in ct. 3. Court advises def of constitutional rights. Court reviews elements and penalties. Def plea is freely and voluntarily given. Court advises def of possible deportation. Def atty is satisfied. Court finds plea is voluntarily given. Court finds factual basis. Court accepts pleas. Court finds def guilty on ct. 1 and ct. 2. Sentencing remarks by state. Sentencing remarks by def atty. Remarks by def. Remarks by court. Court agrees to plea agreement. Court orders on ct. 1 - imposed and stayed 4 yrs prison, 2 yr Initial Confinement, 2 yr extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, probation 3 yrs, costs, DNA sample if not already done, surcharge, complete AODA and assessment and follow through with recommendations, maintain sobriety, full time employment or active seeking, school hours count to fulltime employment, busy 30 hrs a week, participate in counseling deemed necessary by agent. Ct. 2 - withheld 3 yrs probation, costs, DNA, surcharge, same conditions as ct. 1. 0 credit applied. Firearms and voting restrictions applied. Def is eligible for earned release and challenge incarceration programs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def is advised of postconviction rights. Probation in county Def. resides. Court advises move must be approved by probation.  Recess 11:28 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.

03:06 PM Attorney John Zich in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has requested adjournment. State is agreeable to adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:11 PM/Rm. 203/Defendant Christopher S. Hebert in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Christopher S. Hebert in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher S. Hebert appeared by video means with Attorney.  DA, Def. and Reporter by Zoom.  Waiver of preliminary hearing form filed with Court.  Court reviews with Def.  Def. waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds case over for filing of information.  Information filed.  Def.'s Atty. has copy, waives reading and pleads not guilty to all charges in information.  Court accepts pleas and directs clerk to enter into record.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:15 PM Defendant Christopher S. Hebert in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Christopher S. Hebert in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher S. Hebert appeared by video means with Attorney.  All parties via zoom.  Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights and request timely p.h. Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 02:00 PM Defendant Christopher S. Hebert in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher S. Hebert appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Court review history of case.  Def. is eligible for P.D. and is still waiting. Def. questions how to get plea deal on his own.  Court advise def. requested an atty.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

01:06 PM Defendant Christopher S. Hebert in court, in custody. Attorney Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher S. Hebert appeared by video means. All parties via Zoom. Def. is advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Defendant states he would like to hire an attorney. DA gives recommendation. DA recommends $2,500 cash bond. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant heard on bond. Court gives ruling. Court orders $2,000 cash bond with no possession of unprescribed medication. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
